label: A rdfs:label
definition: A definition
device: C (has_specified_input some %) and (realizes some (function and ('inheres in' some %))) SPLIT=|
associated axioms: C % SPLIT=|

label: material processing
definition: A planned process which results in physical changes in a specified input material

label: transplantation
definition: A protocol application to replace an organ or tissue of an organism

label: xenotransplantation
definition: Is the transplantation of living cells, tissues or \norgans from one species to another such as from pigs to humans

label: allotransplantation
definition: Is the transplantation of organs between members of the same species.

label: autotransplantation
definition: Is the transplantation of tissue from one part of \nthe body to another in the same individual. )

label: sample preparation for assay
definition: A sample_preparation_for_assay is a protocol_application including material_enrollments and biomaterial_transformations. definition_source: OBI.

label: sample preparation for sequencing assay
definition: A sample preparation for assay that preparation of nucleic acids for a sequencing assay

label: cell co-culturing
definition: A material combination in which cell cultures of two or more different types are are combined and allowed to culture as one.
associated axioms: ((has_specified_input some cell) and (has_specified_input min 2 owl:Thing))

label: enzymatic cleavage
definition: A material processing that digests the fraction of input material that is susceptible to that enzyme
associated axioms: (realizes some (function and ('inheres in' some enzyme)))

label: non specific enzymatic cleavage
definition: An enzymatic cleavage that uses an enzyme without a strong affinity for specific cleavage sites in the input material

label: specific enzymatic cleavage
definition: An enzymatic cleavage that uses an enzyme with a strong affinity for specific cleavage sites in the input material

label: DNA restriction enzyme digestion
definition: A specific enzymatic cleavage of DNA molecules using endonucleases that cleave DNA molecules at specific sites based on the surrounding nucleotide sequence

label: protease cleavage
definition: Protease cleavage is an enzymatic cleavage which relies on enzyme with protease activity to act on proteins and produce polypeptides (protein fragments).

label: trypsination
definition: Trypsination is a protease cleavage which uses enzyme trypsin to act on proteins present in an input material entity

label: artificially induced nucleic acid hybridization
definition: Is a material transformation in which strands of nucleic acids that are (somewhat) complementary form a double-stranded molecule. Has input at least two single stranded molecules of nucleic acid molecules.

label: suppression subtractive hybridization
definition: An artificially induced nucleic acid hybridization that is performed to compare gene expression in different cell or tissue types based on normalization and suppression, which creates a subtracted cDNA or genomic DNA library.

label: differential screening hybridization
definition: An artificially induced nucleic acid hybridization that is performed to identify differentially expressed genes through hybridization of cDNA probes.

label: histological sample preparation
definition: Histological sample preparation is the preparation of an input tissue via slicing and labeling to make tissue microstructure of interest visible in a future histology assay
associated axioms: ('has participant' some microtome)

label: ionize process
definition: A physical process of converting an atom or molecule into an ion by adding or removing charged particles such as electrons or other ions. This excludes chemical processes of dissociation.
associated axioms: (realizes some 'ionization function')|('has participant' some continuant)

label: cell cycle synchronization
definition: A process with the objective to obtain a cell culture in which all cells are in the same stage of the cell cycle

label: manufacturing
definition: Manufacturing is a process with the intent to produce a processed material which will have a function for future use. A person or organization (having manufacturer role) is a participant in this process

label: material combination
definition: Is a material processing with the objective to combine two or more material entities as input into a single material entity as output.

label: multiplexed nucleotide library sequencing
definition: A planned process which consists in running a set of samples as a pool on a sequencing instrument, while retaining the ability to associate individual results to each of the individual input samples through the use of a ligated oligonucleotide (the "multiplex identifier sequence"). This oligonucleotide is introduced during the sequence library preparation, and is unique to and specific for all library fragments derived from each sample in a sample pool.

label: adding a material entity into a target
definition: Is a process with the objective to place a material entity bearing the 'material to be added role' into a material bearing the 'target of material addition role'.
Input: ('material entity' and ('has role' some 'material to be added role') and ('located in' some ('material entity' and ('has role' some 'target of material addition role'))))
associated axioms: (realizes some 'target of material addition role')|(realizes some 'material to be added role')

label: adding substance to cell culture
definition: Is process in which a material substance is added to a cell culture
parent class: adding a material entity into a target
associated axioms: ((realizes some 'material to be added role') and (realizes some ('target of material addition role' and ('role of' some 'cultured cell population'))))

label: experimental infection of cell culture
definition: Is the administration of an infectious agent to a cell culture with the objective to have the agent colonize and replicate in culture
associated axioms: (realizes some ('material to be added role' and ('inheres in' some 'infectious agent')))

label: administering substance in vivo
definition: A process by which a substance is intentionally given to an organism resulting in exposure of the organism to that substance.
parent class: adding a material entity into a target
associated axioms: ((realizes some 'material to be added role') and (realizes some ('target of material addition role' and ('role of' some (organism or 'material anatomical entity')))))

label: administration in vivo with infectious agent
definition: Is an administration of an infectious agent to a host organism
associated axioms: (realizes some ('material to be added role' and ('role of' some 'infectious agent')))

label: antibiotic administration process
definition: Administering substance in vivo where an antibiotic substance is administered to a living organism.
associated axioms: (realizes some ('material to be added role' and ('role of' some antibacterial)))

label: intradermal injection
definition: Is the injection of a material entity (bearing the administered substance role) into the dermis (bearing the target role) of an organism using a syringe
associated axioms: ((realizes some 'material to be added role') and (realizes some (function and ('inheres in' some syringe))) and (realizes some ('target of material addition role' and ('role of' some dermis))))

label: intramuscular injection
definition: Is the injection of a material entity (bearing the administered substance role) into the muscle (bearing the target role) of an organism using a syringe
associated axioms: ((realizes some 'material to be added role') and (realizes some (function and ('inheres in' some syringe))) and (realizes some ('target of material addition role' and ('role of' some 'skeletal muscle tissue'))))

label: intranasal mucosal administration
definition: The administration of a substance into the intranasal mucosis of an organism
associated axioms: ((realizes some 'material to be added role') and (realizes some ('target of material addition role' and ('role of' some 'mucosa of nasopharynx'))))

label: intraperitoneal administration
definition: The administration of a substance into the peritoneum of an organism
associated axioms: ((realizes some 'material to be added role') and (realizes some ('target of material addition role' and ('role of' some peritoneum))))

label: intraperitoneal injection
definition: Is the injection of a material entity (bearing the administered substance role) into the peritoneum (bearing the target role) of an organism using a syringe
associated axioms: ((realizes some 'material to be added role') and (realizes some (function and ('inheres in' some syringe))) and (realizes some ('target of material addition role' and ('role of' some peritoneum))))

label: intravenous injection
definition: Is the injection of a material entity (bearing the administered substance role) into the vein (bearing the target role) of an organism using a syringe
associated axioms: ((realizes some 'material to be added role') and (realizes some (function and ('inheres in' some syringe))) and (realizes some ('target of material addition role' and ('role of' some vein))))

label: oral administration
definition: An administering substance in vivo into the mouth of an organism
associated axioms: ('administering substance in vivo' and (realizes some ('target of material addition role' and ('role of' some mouth))))

label: oral ingestion of pill
definition: An adding a material entity to target with the entity is a pill and the target is the mouth
associated axioms: ((realizes some ('material to be added role' and ('role of' some pill))) and (realizes some ('target of material addition role' and ('role of' some mouth))) and (has_specified_input some pill))

label: passive immunization
definition: The injection of immune effector material (antibodies, T cells or B cells) into an organism so that the organisms immune system gains its immune effector function to recognize specific antigens.
associated axioms: (realizes some ('material to be added role' and ('inheres in' some 'adaptive immune receptor')))

label: epitope specific immune intervention
definition: An administration in vivo to either actively or passively immunize an organism in order to induce a response against a specific immune epitope
associated axioms: ('passive immunization' or 'Individual epitope immunization in vivo')

label: T cell epitope specific immune intervention
definition: An epitope specific immune intervention in which the induced response targets a T cell epitope

label: B cell epitope specific immune intervention
definition: An epitope specific immune intervention in which the induced response targets a B cell epitope

label: pathogen challenge
definition: A pathogen challenge is the administration of a live pathogenic organism to a host
associated axioms: (realizes some ('target of material addition role' and ('role of' some (organism and ('has role' some 'host role')))))|(realizes some 'host role')|(realizes some ('material to be added role' and ('role of' some (organism and ('has role' some 'pathogen role')))))

label: subcutaneous injection
definition: Is the injection of a material entity (bearing the administered substance role) into the hypodermis (bearing the target role) of an organism using a syringe
associated axioms: ((realizes some 'material to be added role') and (realizes some (function and ('inheres in' some syringe))) and (realizes some ('target of material addition role' and ('role of' some hypodermis))))

label: administration of material to specimen
definition: The directed combination of a material entity with a specimen.
parent class: adding a material entity into a target
associated axioms: (realizes some ('target of material addition role' and ('role of' some specimen)))

label: injection
definition: Injection is process which aims at introducing a compound or a mixture into a material entity (either biological entity or instrument) by relying on devices such as syringe or injector connection, attached or forced into a vascular system (veins of an organism or tubes of a machine) or in a tissue.
parent class: adding a material entity into a target
associated axioms: ((realizes some 'material to be added role') and (realizes some (function and ('inheres in' some syringe))))

label: injection into organ section
definition: A process in which an input substance is injected into a organ section.
associated axioms: ((realizes some 'material to be added role') and (realizes some (function and ('inheres in' some syringe))) and (realizes some ('target of material addition role' and ('role of' some 'organ section'))))

label: creating a mixture of molecules in solution
definition: Is a process with the objective to prepare a liquid solution of one or more chemicals at desired concentrations.

label: pooling specimens
definition: Physical combination of several instances of like material

label: library preparation
definition: Is a process which results in the creation of a library from fragments of DNA using cloning vectors or oligonucleotides with the role of adaptors.
output: ('clonal cDNA library' or 'paired-end library' or 'single fragment library' or 'phage display library')

label: paired-end library preparation
definition: A library preparation that results in the creation of a library of the 5' and 3' ends of DNA or cDNA fragments using adaptors and endonucleases. The preparation may or may not include cloning process.

label: SAGE ditag library preparation
definition: A library preparation in which tags identifiying transcripts are created, ligated to form ditags, amplified, concatemerized and ligated into a vector to create a library.

label: vaccine preparation
definition: Vaccine preparation is a planned process with specified output a vaccine

label: cross linking
definition: A process in which bonds are created that link one polymer to another

label: denaturing
definition: Is a process in which the tertiary or secondary structure of a polymer is disrupted

label: induced hemagglutination
definition: The clumping or clustering of red blood cells caused by certain viruses, antibodies, or other substances

label: chemical cleavage
definition: Chemical cleavage is a protocol application relying on a chemical compound to cause the fragmentation of an input material that is susceptible to that chemical agent
Input: specimen|('molecular entity' and ('has role' some 'reagent role'))

label: cell culture expansion
definition: A process that results in the increase of cell numbers

label: phage display library panning
definition: Phage display library panning is a process in which a diverse collection of phages encoding peptides or proteins are screened and the ones encoding active peptides/proteins are selected in an iterative process similar to natural selection.

label: dissection
definition: A planned process that separates and isolates tissues for surgical purposes, or for the analysis or study of their structures.

label: specimen family creation
definition: A material processing that has as its input a specimen and as its output a collection of specimens.

label: passage process
definition: A material processing that consists of first growing an organism in an environmental system and then removing the organism to be grown in another environmental system, a process which may be repeated with the objective of altering the organism or increasing its number.

label: staining
definition: Staining is a process which results in the addition a class-specific (DNA, proteins, lipids, carbohydrates) dye to a substrate to qualify or quantify the presence of a specific compound.

label: IHC slide staining
definition: A staining using labeled antibodies, i.e. the analytical part of immunohistochemistry. The staining is applied to fixed specimens on slides to identify biomarkers in tissues.

label: H&E slide staining
definition: A staining using hematoxylin and eosin. The staining is applied to fixed specimens on slides to observe the whole structure and morphology of cells in a tissue; nuclei are stained dark blue/purple while cytoplasm is stained pink.

label: washing
definition: Washing is a process by which a material entity acting as contaminant (e.g. excess staining reagent) is removed by application of one or more cycles of solution in flow.

label: irradiation
definition: Irradiation is a process by which a material entity is exposed to radiative energy, which could be ionizing radiation (such as gamma rays or X-rays) or not such as UV light or microwaves
associated axioms: ('has participant' some 'light source')

label: polymerization
definition: Polymerization is process by which molecular entity of small mass are aggregated in motifs over the course of a chemical reaction catalyzed by enzymes or other molecular entities acting as catalyst. polymerization results in molecular entity of high molecular weight

label: enzymatic ligation
definition: An enzymatic ligation is a planned process in which molecules are joined by covalent bonds through the action of an material entity with a ligase activity
associated axioms: (realizes some (function and ('inheres in' some enzyme)))

label: immobilization
definition: Immbolization is a process by which material entity become (possibly covalently but not necessarily) attached to the surface of another material entity used a substratum.

label: nucleic acid hybridization
definition: A planned process by which totally or partially complementary, single-stranded nucleic acids are combined into a single molecule called heteroduplex or homoduplex to an extent depending on the amount of complementarity.
associated axioms: (realizes some (function and ('inheres in' some 'hybridization chamber')))

label: elution
definition: The process of extracting one material from another by washing with a solvent to remove adsorbed material from an adsorbent (as in washing of loaded ion-exchange resins to remove captured ions)
associated axioms: ('has participant' some 'chromatography column')

label: killing
definition: A protocol application in which an organism is intentionally put to death

label: animal euthanization
definition: A process in which is the end of life of animal is brought about in accordance with local regulations on treatment of animal subjects and using a method which causes minimal pain and distress to the animal subject

label: asphyxiation
definition: Asphyxiation is a process by which oxygen supplies are restricted (by mechanical, e.g obstructing airways or chemical means, e.g. increasing CO2 partial pressure) resulting in termination of life in oxygen reliant organisms

label: cervical dislocation
definition: Cervical dislocation is a process by which a Vertebrate organism has its life terminated by rupturing spinal cord between cervical vertebrae induced by excessive mechanical torsion

label: decapitation
definition: Decapitation is a process by which the head of a living organism is physically removed from the body, usually resulting in rapid death (in the case of Rhodnius prolixus, it might take a bit longer..)

label: electrocution
definition: Electrocution is process by which electric current is applied to a material with quality alive and result the termination of life process.
associated axioms: ('has participant' some 'power supply')

label: intentional overdosing
definition: Intentional overdosing is a process by which an excess dose of a chemical compound is given with the intent of causing death

label: cell lysis
definition: Cell lysis is a process by which cell membrane integrity of live cells is compromised and leads to cell death. Cell lysis may be achieved by means of viral action or osmotic shock.

label: material component separation
definition: A material processing in which components of an input material become segregated in space

label: isolation of cell population
definition: A process in which a population of cells with certain characteristics is isolated from a larger population

label: isolation of PBMCs
definition: A process in which cells with a single nucleus are isolated from a blood sample

label: isolation of adherent cells
definition: A material separation process in which cells that stick to the container in which they are grown as a cell culture are separated from those in the liquid component of the culture. The output of this process are adherent cells.

label: immunoprecipitation
definition: Is a process which realizes a material separation objective by relying on antibodies to specifically binding to material entity

label: chromatin immunoprecipitation
definition: An immunoprecipitation in which chromatin (i.e. packaged DNA which can include protein and RNA complexes) is cut into short regions, reversibly cross linked, and antibodies or tags are used to select for pieces of chromatin with desired characteristics.

label: cell collecting
definition: A planned process that collects cells from culture.

label: purification
definition: A planned process to separate a material entity into different compositions of which one or more have are purified fractions that contain higher concentration of a desired component, while others contain impurities and are not of interest

label: platelet-poor plasma preparation process
definition: A material component separation process in which (1) whole blood is first centrifuged to separate red blood cells from blood plasma, which forms the supernatant, and (2) the blood plasma is then centrifuged to separate platelets from the plasm.

label: extraction
definition: A material separation in which a desired component of an input material is separated from the remainder

label: nucleic acid extraction
definition: A material separation to recover the nucleic acid fraction of an input material
Input: ('sample from organism' or organism or 'cultured cell population')

label: RNA extraction
definition: A RNA extraction is a nucleic acid extraction where the desired output material is RNA

label: viral RNA extraction
definition: The extraction of RNA from an input material that specifically isolates viral RNA

label: RNA extraction with polyA depletion
definition: A RNA extraction process in which only RNAs lacking a polyA tail are retained

label: polyA RNA extraction
definition: A RNA extraction process typically involving the use of poly dT oligomers in which the desired output material is polyA RNA.

label: organellar RNA extraction
definition: A RNA extraction process in which the desired output material is RNA in the organelle(s).

label: total RNA extraction
definition: A RNA extraction process in which total cellular and organelle RNA are extracted.

label: nuclear RNA extraction
definition: A RNA extraction process in which the desired output material is RNA in the nucleus.

label: cytoplasmic RNA extraction
definition: A RNA extraction process in which the desired output material is RNA in the cytoplasm.

label: DNA extraction
definition: A DNA extraction is a nucleic acid extraction where the desired output material is DNA.

label: filtration
definition: Filtration is a process which separates components suspended in a fluid based on granularity properties relying on a filter device
associated axioms: ('has participant' some 'filter paper')

label: centrifugation
definition: Centrifugation is a process separating molecules by size or density using centrifugal forces generated by a spinning rotor. G-forces of several hundred thousand times gravity are generated in ultracentrifugation
associated axioms: ('has participant' some centrifuge)

label: DNA Subtraction
definition: A material separation process by which repetitive genomic DNA is removed during the construction of cDNA library.

label: material portioning
definition: A material processing in which the input substance is partitioned into a number of portions that are similar in composition.

label: excision
definition: The use physical means to remove a portion of a substance from the rest

label: isolation of cell culture supernatant
definition: A protocol which results in the separation of supernatant material from a cell culture

label: precipitation
definition: A protocol application to cause a material to precipitate (becoming a solid) out of solution. Input is a solution, output is a solution plus a solid component (the precipitate)

label: cell culture splitting
definition: The act of taking part of a homogeneous cell culture and creating one or more additional separate cultures of similar qualities. input: cell_culture, output cell_culture min cardinality 2. part of cell culturing

label: concentrate
definition: A protocol application to create an output material with an increased density of a material of interest that is part of the input material by separating other parts of the input material

label: lavage
definition: A protocol application to separate cells and/or cellular secretions from an anatomical space by the introduction and removal of fluid
associated axioms: collecting specimen from organism

label: preparative chromatography
definition: The use of a biomaterial's preferential affinity for either the mobile phase or the stationary phase to separate it from other materials of differing affinity
associated axioms: ('has participant' some 'chromatography device')|('has participant' some 'chromatography column')

label: gradient separation
definition: A protocol application that uses different concentrations of materials in a defined order to create a gradient to facilitate the separation of an input material into its components with specific qualities

label: dialysis
definition: A protocol application that uses diffusion through a semi-permeable membrane to separate an input material into two fractions of different composition

label: electrophoresis
definition: A protocol application that uses an electrical potential to move material through a defined matrix in order to separate it by its resistance to movement and its charge
associated axioms: ('has participant' some 'gel tank')|('has participant' some 'power supply')

label: immunoelectrophoresis
definition: An electrophoresis that separates and characterize proteins based on reaction with antibodies.

label: counter current immunoelectrophoresis
definition: An electrophoresis in which antigen and antibody move in opposite directions and form precipitates in the area between the cells where they meet in concentrations of optimal proportions.

label: organ harvesting
definition: The process of removing an organ from its source organism

label: blood harvesting
definition: A material separation where blood is taken from an organism.

label: leukapheresis
definition: A blood harvesting process in which white blood cells are separated from a blood specimen.

label: cell fixation
definition: A protocol application to preserve defined qualities of cells or tissues (sample) which may otherwise change over time
Input: (cell and ('located in' some specimen))|('molecular entity' or 'chemical solution')

label: artificially induced cell membrane lysis
definition: A material transformation to break the membranes of cells, releasing the cells contents; input=>cells; output=>cell_lysate

label: artificially induced reverse transcription
definition: A protocol with the objective to transcribe single-stranded RNA into complementary DNA (cDNA)

label: experimental disease induction
definition: A protocol application to induce a specific disease in an organism

label: artificially induced DNA repair
definition: A protocol application to repair damaged DNA molecules

label: cell permeabilization
definition: A protocol application to permeabilize cell membranes, allowing molecules to more easily pass through the membrane than was possible prior to the protocol application

label: electroporation
definition: A process in which a significant increase in the electrical conductivity and permeability of the cell plasma membrane caused by an externally applied electrical field. It is usually used in molecular biology as a way of introducing some substance into a cell, such as loading it with a molecular probe, a drug that can change the cell's function, or a piece of coding DNA
associated axioms: ('has participant' some 'power supply')

label: establishing cell culture
definition: A process through which a new type of cell culture or cell line is created, either through the isolation and culture of one or more cells from a fresh source, or the deliberate experimental modification of an existing cell culture (e.g passaging a primary culture to become a secondary culture or line, or the immortalization or stable genetic modification of an existing culture or line).

label: establishing cell line
definition: A process whereby a new type of cell line is created, either through passaging of a primary cell culture to relative genetic stability and compositional homogeneity, or through some experimental modification of an existing cell line to produce a new line with novel characteristics (e.g. immortalization or some other stable genetic modification, or selection of some defined subset).

label: establishing cancer cell line
definition: Is a planned process in which the objective is to generate a cell line from a natural population of cancer cells which are already immortal

label: cell line immortalization
definition: An establishing cell line process whereby a mortal cell line is intentionally genetically modified to be capable of indefinite propagation and re-established as a new immortal cell line
alternative term: establishing immortal cell line through directed genetic modification'

label: establishing primary cell culture
definition: An establishing cell culture process whereby cells explanted directly from an organismal source or specimen, and placed in culture for maintenance or propagation as a primary cell culture

label: addition of molecular label
definition: A material processing technique intended to add a molecular label to some input material entity, to allow detection of the molecular target of this label in a detection of molecular label assay

label: random primed DNA labeling
definition: A labeling in which random primers are used to uniformly label input DNA

label: non-specific labeling
definition: The addition of a reagent labeling the entire input biomaterial enabling future detection of the output biomaterial

label: specific labeling
definition: A labeling in which the labeling reagent used has a specificity to bind only certain components of the input material

label: artificially induced methylation
definition: A planned process of adding methyl groups to polymers

label: synthesis
definition: The construction of a biomaterial from simpler biomaterials

label: genetic transformation
definition: The introduction. alteration or integration of genetic material into a cell or organism

label: immortalizing cell line transformation
definition: A genetic transformation of a cell line cell with transgenic constructs intended to confer the capability for indefinite propagation in culture

label: gene knock out
definition: A genetic transformation that renders a gene non-functional, e.g. due to a point mutation, or the removal of all, or part of, the gene using recombinant methods.

label: gene knock in
definition: A genetic transformation that renders a gene non-functional, e.g. due to a point mutation, or the removal of all, or part of, the gene using recombinant methods.

label: chromosomal substitution
definition: A genetic transformation in which all, or part, of a chromosome from a donor replaces that of the recipient. It does not include chromosome recombination. For single gene insertion, use the term 'gene knock in'.

label: transfection
definition: A genetic transformation which relies on the use of physical, electrical and chemical phenomena to introduce DNA or RNA into a cell
Input: (('deoxyribonucleic acid' or 'ribonucleic acid') and ('bearer of' some 'target of material addition role'))

label: DNA transfection
definition: A transfection which relies on the use of physical, electrical and chemical phenomena to introduce DNA into a cell
Input: ('deoxyribonucleic acid' and ('bearer of' some 'target of material addition role'))

label: induced mutagenesis
definition: A genetic transformation that is the modification of the genetic material (either coding or non-coding) of an organism caused by mutagenic processes, compounds, or irradiation.

label: site-directed mutagenesis
definition: An induced mutation in which a specific base change is programmed into the sequence of a synthetic primer.

label: random mutagenesis
definition: An induced mutation that produces a random mutation, either by introducing the organism to mutagens, or through a process such as error-prone PCR.

label: chemical mutagenesis
definition: A form of random mutagenesis that produces a mutation by introducing the organism to a chemical mutagen.

label: irradiation mutagenesis
definition: A form of random mutagenesis that produces a random mutation by exposing the organism to radiation.

label: transgenic mutagenesis
definition: A form of random mutagenesis that produces a mutation by introducing a construct into the genome of an organism in a random or semi-random fashion.

label: gene-trap mutagenesis
definition: A transgenic mutagenesis that produces a mutation by introducing a construct designed to capture the expression of an endogenous gene by creating a spliced fusion transcript when inserted into the genome of an organism.

label: enhancer-trap mutagenesis
definition: A transgenic mutagenesis that produces a mutation by introducing a construct designed to monitor transcriptionally active regions when inserted into the genome of an organism by inserting a reporter gene that requires cis-acting DNA sequences in the genome to activate reporter gene expression.

label: transposon-induced mutagenesis
definition: A random mutagenesis in which expression of a transposase causes the mobilization of an artificial or modified transposable element with the insertion of the element into the genome creating a mutation.

label: directed mutagenesis
definition: An induced mutation in which a specific gene(s) or part of a gene(s) is altered.

label: endonuclease mediated mutagenesis
definition: A directed mutagenesis in which guide RNAs and an endonuclease (cas9, TALEN) are used to introduce a mutation at a specific location in a gene.

label: TALEN mediated mutagenesis
definition: An endonuclease mediated mutagenesis in which guide RNAs and transcription activator-like effector nucleases (TALENs) are used to introduce a mutation at a specific location in the genome.

label: cas mediated mutagenesis
definition: An endonuclease mediated mutagenesis in which guide RNAs and cas are used to introduce a mutation at a specific location in the genome.

label: zinc finger mediated mutagenesis
definition: An endonuclease mediated mutagenesis in which synthetic zinc-finger proteins designed to target specific DNA sequences are used to introduce a mutation at a specific location in the genome.

label: targeted mutagenesis
definition: A directed mutation in which a construct is used to introduce a mutation into a specific genome location through homologous recombination.

label: gene knockdown
definition: A genetic transformation which reduces the expression of a specific gene or genes in an organism.

label: RNAi gene knockdown
definition: A gene knockdown that silences genes through artificially-induced RNA interference. This is accomplished by introducing small double-stranded interfering RNA complementary to the target mRNA to be silenced, which is then cleaved by a ribonuclease.

label: DNA transduction
definition: A genetic transformation which relies on the use of lysogenic infection to transfer DNA sequences into an organism

label: selection by survival
definition: The use of environmental conditions to select for the organism or cells that have a certain trait

label: enzymatic amplification
definition: The use of enzymes to increase the number of molecules of a biomaterial
Input: ('material entity' and ('has role' some 'nucleic acid template role'))
associated axioms: (realizes some (function and ('inheres in' some enzyme)))

label: polymerase chain reaction
definition: PCR is the process in which a DNA polymerase is used to amplify a piece of DNA by in vitro enzymatic replication. As PCR progresses, the DNA thus generated is itself used as a template for replication. This sets in motion a chain reaction in which the DNA template is exponentially amplified.
associated axioms: (realizes some ('synthesizing function' and ('inheres in' some 'DNA polymerase complex')))

label: multiplex ligation-mediated amplification
definition: A polymerase chain reaction that amplifies multiple targets with a single primer pair mediated by hybridization of a primer with its target sequence using ligation.

label: inverse polymerase chain reaction
definition: A polymerase chain reaction which amplifies DNA with only one known sequence from which primers may be designed. A series of restriction digestions and ligations result in a looped DNA fragment which can be primed for PCR.

label: short interspersed nuclear elements polymerase chain reaction
definition: A polymerase chain reaction that amplifies short interspersed nuclear elements (SINEs).

label: nested polymerase chain reaction
definition: A polymerase chain reaction with modification intended to reduce non-specific binding in products due to the amplification of unexpected primer binding sites. The nested polymerase chain reaction (PCR) involves the use of two primer sets and two successive PCR reactions. The first set of primers are designed to anneal to sequences upstream from the second set of primers and are used in an initial PCR reaction.

label: reverse transcribed polymerase chain reaction
definition: Reverse transcribe pcr is a process which allow amplification of cDNA during a pcr reaction while the cDNA results from a retrotranscription of messenger RNA isolated from a material entity.
material processing: ('polymerase chain reaction' and ('immediately preceded by' some 'artificially induced reverse transcription'))

label: rapid amplification of cDNA ends
definition: A reverse transcribed polymerase chain reaction that is used to amplify a mRNA sequence between a defined internal site and the 5' or 3' end of the mRNA.

label: 3' rapid amplification of cDNA ends
definition: A rapid amplication of cDNA ends to amplify a mRNA sequence between a defined internal site and the 3' end of the mRNA.

label: 5' rapid amplification of cDNA ends
definition: A rapid amplication of cDNA ends to amplify a mRNA sequence between a defined internal site and the 5' end of the mRNA.

label: 5' RNA ligase mediated rapid amplification of cDNA ends
definition: A 5' rapid amplification pf cDNA ends that uses RNA ligase to add an RNA adapter oligonucleotide to intact 5' mRNA ends, allowing the amplification of cDNA only from full-length, capped mRNA.

label: linear amplification
definition: An enzymatic amplification which amplifies nucleic acid sequence by making many copies off the same template.

label: ligase detection reaction
definition: A linear amplification that uses a thermostable ligase to amplify a piece of DNA. Because the enzyme retains activity after multiple thermal cycles, the ligations may be repeated to linearly increase product.

label: loop-mediated isothermal amplification
definition: An enzymatic amplification in which a piece of DNA is amplified at a constant temperature of 60 - 65 degree C using either two or three sets of primers and a polymerase with high strand displacement activity in addition to a replication activity. This amplification does not need thermal cyclers and may be a low cost alternative to PCR.

label: DNA polymerase amplification
definition: DNA polymerase amplification is an enzymatic amplification which uses DNA polymerase enzyme to make copies of a DNA contained in biomaterial used as input
Input: DNA polymerase complex|('ribonucleic acid' and ('located in' some 'material entity'))

label: enzymatic DNA replication
definition: The use of enzymes to duplicate DNA molecule any process used to make additional copies of a biomaterial

label: recombinant vector cloning
definition: A planned process with the objective to insert genetic material into a cloning vector for future replication of the inserted material
Input: cloning vector|('material entity' and ('has role' some 'cloning insert role'))
associated axioms: ('realizes' some 'cloning vector role')

label: nucleotide overhang cloning
definition: Nucleotide overhang cloning is the process of inserting nucleic acid into a vector using nucleotide overhangs used to prevent self ligation

label: recombination enzyme based cloning
definition: Restriction enzyme based cloning is a recombinant vector cloning process that has as an input genetic material that was cleaved with restriction enzymes, and a cloning vector that was cleaved with complementary restriction enzymes. It uses ligase to chemically join the input genetic material and the cloning vector to create a recombinant vector.

label: restriction enzyme based cloning
definition: Restriction enzyme based cloning is a recombinant vector cloning process that has as an input genetic material that was cleaved with restriction enzymes, and a cloning vector that was cleaved with complementary restriction enzymes. It uses ligase to chemically join the input genetic material and the cloning vector to create a recombinant vector.

label: recombinant BAC cloning
definition: Recombinant BAC cloning is a process with the objective to insert genetic material into an F plasmid based bacterial artificial chromosome for future replication of the inserted material

label: recombinant phage cloning
definition: Recombinant phage cloning is the process of using a phage plus some insert nucleic acid for the purposes of amplification of the insert material achieved by phage assembly in vitro.

label: recombinant YAC cloning
definition: Recombinant YAC cloning is a process with the objective to insert genetic material into a yeast artificial chromosome vector for future replication of the inserted material

label: recombinant plasmid cloning
definition: The insertion of a particular DNA fragment into a plasmid in order to make copies of a biomaterial

label: vector mediated amplification
definition: The process of creating a copy of some biological entity in cell culture

label: vector mediated expression
definition: Vector mediated expression sis the generation of copies of biomaterial by in a cell_culture modified for this purpose by insertion of an expression vector

label: Immunization in vitro
definition: Process of administering an object playing the role of immunogen to a cell culture
associated axioms: ('has part' some immunization)
